column11: A popular tourist destination for its temples, its sandy, palm tree filled coastal stretch of beach and the Keerimalai Springs, other prominent landmarks in Kankesanthurai include the suburb's natural harbour, its fort and lighthouse

This beach surprised me a lot, in a good way. According to reviews i had a very low expactations. The sea was clean and the beach as well. It was safe to swim and the colour of the sea on a sunny days just make my experience unforgetable.

Beach is pretty good, filled with crushed rocks and coral in the shallow end. The Navy maintains the beach and have added new showers, canteen and cabana umbrellas with seats. However I couldn't find toilet facilities, and parking was on the side of the road. The naval sentry did make an exception and allowed us to take the car inside so my disabled mother could get out and get in easily. I think they'll improve in coming years

Local beach. The sea is not excellent and it is quite dirty. It can be easily reached from jaffna station by bus. Bring your own food and drink because there is nothing around except a small bar that makes shakes.
With a breakwater, a lighthouse etc on one side and the sheer beauty of the sea on the other, KKS beach is a superb option for beach lovers!
This is   beach basically in the northern tip of Srilanka. A beautiful beach. This is good for a morning or evening walks.
